thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Copper Extends Slide on Demand Worries

author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Copper Extends Slide on Demand Worries
text:
Copper prices fell for the second straight session Thursday, as investors continue to wonder if an economic slowdown in China could limit demand for the industrial metal.
Copper for May delivery was down 1.6% at $3.0865 a pound on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have fallen about 6% so far this year after hitting a roughly four-year high in late December, with some analysts warning that the market is still currently well supplied and demand could slow moving forward.
